Прит 3:1-35: "Сын мой! наставления моего не забывай, и заповеди мои да хранит сердце твое; ибо долготы дней, лет жизни и мира они приложат тебе. Милость и истина да не оставляют тебя: обвяжи ими шею твою, напиши их на скрижали сердца твоего, и обретешь милость и благоволение в очах Бога и людей. Надейся на Господа всем сердцем твоим, и не полагайся на разум твой. Во всех путях твоих познавай Его, и Он направит стези твои. Не будь мудрецом в глазах твоих; бойся Господа и удаляйся от зла: это будет здравием для тела твоего и питанием для костей твоих. Чти Господа от имения твоего и от начатков всех прибытков твоих, и наполнятся житницы твои до избытка, и точила твои будут переливаться новым вином. Наказания Господня, сын мой, не отвергай, и не тяготись обличением Его; ибо кого любит Господь, того наказывает и благоволит к тому, как отец к сыну своему. Блажен человек, который снискал мудрость, и человек, который приобрел разум, — потому что приобретение ее лучше приобретения серебра, и прибыли от нее больше, нежели от золота: она дороже драгоценных камней; и ничто из желаемого тобою не сравнится с нею. Долгоденствие — в правой руке ее, а в левой у нее — богатство и слава; пути ее — пути приятные, и все стези ее — мирные. Она — древо жизни для тех, которые приобретают ее, — и блаженны, которые сохраняют ее! Господь премудростью основал землю, небеса утвердил разумом; Его премудростью разверзлись бездны, и облака кропят росою. Сын мой! не упускай их из глаз твоих; храни здравомыслие и рассудительность, и они будут жизнью для души твоей и украшением для шеи твоей. Тогда безопасно пойдешь по пути твоему, и нога твоя не споткнется. Когда ляжешь спать, — не будешь бояться; и когда уснешь, — сон твой приятен будет. Не убоишься внезапного страха и пагубы от нечестивых, когда она придет; потому что Господь будет упованием твоим и сохранит ногу твою от уловления. Не отказывай в благодеянии нуждающемуся, когда рука твоя в силе сделать его. Не говори другу твоему: «пойди и приди опять, и завтра я дам», когда ты имеешь при себе. Не замышляй против ближнего твоего зла, когда он без опасения живет с тобою. Не ссорься с человеком без причины, когда он не сделал зла тебе. Не соревнуй человеку, поступающему насильственно, и не избирай ни одного из путей его; потому что мерзость пред Господом развратный, а с праведными у Него общение. Проклятие Господне на доме нечестивого, а жилище благочестивых Он благословляет. Если над кощунниками Он посмевается, то смиренным дает благодать. Мудрые наследуют славу, а глупые — бесславие." Аминь. Слава Иисусу Христу!

Hey Destin! I watched this video like a year ago - but then today I suddenly had an ‘aha!’ moment as a result!

I have this globe on my desk that is suspended inside a plastic globe, and a clear fluid - essentially free-spinning inside the ball. I couldn’t get it to work properly and spin, without going backwards - but it was supposed to just keep going in the direction the earth actually turns.

I looked over at it today - and this video came to mind - and it clicked. I needed to spin the outside globe in the right direction to ‘wind up’ the fluids inside - which then pull the interior globe in the same direction.

Mind blown. Thanks man!

Hey Destin, I came across something quite interesting recently. I was making hot chocolate and to cool it off I placed an ice cube in the cup. What happened next surprised me, the liquid started to swirl as if I had just stirred it. I found this fascinating enough to where I did it again; on my third time around nothing happened. Assuming it was the heat of the water acting on the melting ice I made another cup and sure enough, it started swirling again. The ice I was using was cylindrical in shape and around 2.5cm. I did this again tonight and decided to measure the variables. At my altitude of 239M above sea level, the temperature of the water had to be no less than 79C, and the ice, if larger than 3.3cm wouldn't produce this effect. The cup was 11cm in diameter and 10cm tall.

Now that all of that is on the table, here's my question. Do you know what causes this, or would you be able to help me figure this out? I understand that it isn't very interesting for most, but it is baffling me as to why it happens.

Thanks!

The plan, two holes in the lid of the bucket each about 1 1/4 inch, one in the middle, and one closer to the side of the bucket. The hole in the middle gets a piece of tubing inserted 4 to 6 inches into the bucket, and the other hole gets an elbow pointing into the side of the bucket. The overall direction the elbows facing determines the direction the vortex will spend. The air and dust enter the bucket, hit the wall and spin with the vortex. The dust can't immediately exit because of the pipe sticking down the middle. I'm sorry but the metaphor breaks down really fast for me. Take it from someone who has spent the last 7 years studying fluid flows. Yes, life is messy and jumbled up, but if everything can be set straight, you can go back, then it assumes that life has always been laminar to begin with. Laminar flows are the most restrictive flows that exist, in laminar flows you can't change the path you are on, i.e. they are represent the idea that destiny exists. Turbulent flows are random, chaotic, unpredictable, most importantly they allow for change, however, once the change is made it cannot be undone you can only go on. So yes, life is turbulent but if you apply enough energy and effort you can change the path you are on.

If you also look at it form a bigger perspective, we don't measure flows on the impact of a single particle we measure them as a whole. It's the same for people, history does not look at the path every single person has taken, it looks at how society has changed as a whole over time. In a laminar framework, for society to arrive at its destination everyone needs to behave exactly the same, no deviations. In a turbulent flow, so long as enough energy is put into the system, it will also get there, but most importantly nobody is the same.

Finally, if everything were to stop right now, from a laminar perspective, you can wait and then restart again without any change. Not in a turbulent system, it needs energy to survive, without energy it quickly break down. This is what life is, if you removed all the knowledge and wisdom that pushes our society forwards, life would quickly disappear but you can't just restart it by putting it all back. Turbulent flows are also characterised by the energy cascade, over time the energy of the largest structures gets distributed to the smallest structures all too keep the flow moving forwards until these small structures dissipate. This is the same for life new generations are born full of life and then they use this energy to, as a whole, move us forwards. This push becomes less and less as they age until they no longer can and die.

actually i dont think that this is real fluidal beahaviour. a fluid would behave like a lose rope between 2 surfaces. what we can see here is a behaviour that is more like a stretching rubberband between 2 surfaces.
what do i mean by that?
imagine you attach the ends of a long rope to the 2 surfaces and turn the inner cylinder till the rope is completeley wound up.
now if you unwind the inncer cylinder it will start moving only the end back to the starting point which is attached to the inner cylinder. in the end the half of the rope closer to the outer cylinder will not have unwound at all.
this is an analogy to fluids where parts are not restrained in some special order and only move with each other because of cohesion force between the molecules.

now imagine doing the same with a rubberband which is tensioned between the 2 cylinders. After unwinding the rubberband will look exactly the same as in the beginning. That is exactly what we see in the video
this however is more an analogy to (elastic) solid materials where molecules move together not only because of cohesian forces but also because they are bound together in a defined structure where they can not move freely.
something tells me that we have some related behaviour the the fenomenon of non newtonian fluids here, especially considering that this fluid is corn sirup which is for sure similar to the famous non newtonian starch+water mix...

People do the same thing to make interesting pattern in glass when doing something called lamp blowing. One thing is to have a hollow tube of glass and a oxy propane torch.. heat and laydown stripes of colored glass.. Then melt in and attach a punny.. Something to the other end. and heat and twist. Then.. When twisted.. Lay down more straight lines over it.. melt in then untwist (while hot and flowing correctly) and stop halfway.. You'll have a mesh weave pattern going at angles. That also will happen with glass if you use different color glasses..  Clear and a color have different melting points and flow differently.. Some colors flow better than others.

One of the definitional features of laminar flow, and in particular laminar flow at very low Reynolds numbers, is the zero mass transfer between the layers of flow (for want of a better word). Zero mixing between the layers means that if the different coloured drops of dye were located at different radial distances within the gap of the rotating cylinders, then the colours will not mix and the stretching out of the dye could be effectively reversed.


You can repeat this experiment within a transparent tube and create a similar laminar flow type shear field. If you insert different colour dye droplets at different locations within the cross sectional area of the tube, you will achieve the same effect. That is the dye drops will stretch along the length of the tube in the direction of the laminar flow and become long strands or strings. These should be able to be reversed by reversing the direction of the flow.



Q1. At what location within the tube will the stand length be maximised? [2 marks]



It's common to use dyes to determine flow regimes and behaviour in fluid mechanics - especially in turbulent flow regimes where the flow becomes quite complex (vortex as well as stagnant flow formation etc).

One of my physics professors did this in class to show us that things can be "reversible" despite not appearing that way (we were discussing thermodynamics). At the time I did not understand there were spirals, so I thought the dyes had literally overlapped and that it was pure witchcraft that separated them. I had a huge "OH" moment with 7 years pent-up mystery thanks to this video.


In a perfect system, spirals should never be able to intersect, but winding up the spiral many times means that any dye that moves radially a little bit will be much farther from its own color dye at that radius. A simplified wound up spiral of dye can be described as R = (small slope) * theta. Dtheta = DR/small slope = big number times DR. Dtheta is conserved when unwinding, so dye that moved radially DR when wound up ends up Dtheta away from the other dye when unwound.


So the imperfections result from spiral-amplified diffusion.
